==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|竜馬|竜馬 (for shogi)}}
{{wikipedia|Shogi#Promoted_bishop}}
[[Image:Shogi_bishop_p.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|竜馬}} (''ryūme'', ''ryūma''): A [[shogi]] piece representing a [[promoted]] [[bishop]].]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|りゅう|め}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=りゅうめ}} {{m|zh|龍馬|tr=ljowng mæ<sup>X</sup>|lit=dragon + horse}}. The [[呉音#Japanese|goon]] reading, so likely the initial borrowing.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|りゅうめ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|りゅうめ|kyu=龍馬}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=りゅうめ|idiomatic}} an [[excellent]] [[horse]], a very [[fast]] horse
# {{lb|ja|sort=りゅうめ|shogi}} a [[promoted]] [[bishop]]

=====Synonyms=====
{{der-top|Synonyms}}
* {{sense|horse}} {{m|ja|駿馬|tr=shunme</i>, <i>shunba}}, {{m|ja|良馬|tr=ryōba}}
* {{sense|shogi}} {{m|ja|成り角|tr=narikaku}}, {{m|ja|成った角|tr=natta kaku}}, {{m|ja|馬|tr=uma}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|りゅう|ま}}
Alteration of ''ryūme'' above, using the [[慣用音#Japanese|kan'yōon]] reading of ''ma'' for the {{ja-l|馬}} character.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|りゅうま}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|りゅうま|kyu=龍馬}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=りゅうま|shogi}} a [[promoted]] [[bishop]]

=====Usage notes=====
The ''ryūma'' reading is common, but might be considered by some to be less technically correct than the ''ryūme'' reading.<ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref>

=====Synonyms=====
{{der-top|Synonyms}}
* {{m|ja|成り角|tr=narikaku}}
* {{m|ja|成った角|tr=natta kaku}}
* {{m|ja|馬|tr=uma}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|りょう|ば}}
Shift in pronunciation ''ryūme'' above. The [[漢音#Japanese|kan'on]] for both characters, so probably a re-borrowing from a later stage of {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=りょうば}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|りょうば}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|りょうば|kyu=龍馬}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=りょうば|idiomatic}} an [[excellent]] [[horse]], a very [[fast]] horse

=====Usage notes=====
This is a [[homophone]] with the synonymous spelling {{m|ja|良馬|tr=ryōba|lit=good horse}}.

=====Synonyms=====
{{der-top|Synonyms}}
* {{m|ja|駿馬|tr=shunme</i>, <i>shunba}}
* {{m|ja|良馬|tr=ryōba}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|りょう|め}}
Alteration of ''ryūme'' above, using the [[漢音#Japanese|kan'on]] reading of ''ryō'' for the {{ja-l|竜}} character.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|りょうめ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|りょうめ|kyu=龍馬}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=りょうめ|idiomatic}} an [[excellent]] [[horse]], a very [[fast]] horse

=====Synonyms=====
{{der-top|Synonyms}}
* {{m|ja|駿馬|tr=shunme</i>, <i>shunba}}
* {{m|ja|良馬|tr=ryōba}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 5===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|りょう|ま}}
Probably an alteration of ''ryōba'' above, using the [[慣用音#Japanese|kan'yōon]] reading of ''ma'' for the {{ja-l|馬}} character.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|りょうま}}

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|りょうま|kyu=龍馬}}

# {{surname|lang=ja|sort=りょうま}}

===Etymology 6===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|たつ|うま|sort=たつのうま}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=たつのうま|竜|tr1=tatsu|t1=dragon|の|tr2=no|pos2=possessive particle|馬|tr3=uma|t3=horse}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> The ''no'' is implied in this spelling.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|たつ の うま}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|竜の馬}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|たつ の うま|kyu=龍馬}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=たつのうま|idiomatic}} an [[excellent]] [[horse]], a very [[fast]] horse
#* {{RQ:Manyoshu|5|808}}, [http://jti.lib.virginia.edu/japanese/manyoshu/Man5Yos.html#808 text here]
#*: {{lang|ja|'''多都乃麻'''乎 阿礼波毛等米牟}}
#*: {{lang|ja|'''たつのま'''を あれはもとめむ}}
#*:: '''''Tatsu no ma''' o / are wa motomemu''
#*::: “I would want a '''dragon horse'''...”
#*::: (Note that the ancient form of ''uma'' was sometimes rendered as ''ma'' or ''muma''. See the etymology at {{ja-l|馬}} for more details.)

=====Synonyms=====
{{der-top|Synonyms}}
* {{m|ja|駿馬|tr=shunme</i>, <i>shunba}}
* {{m|ja|良馬|tr=ryōba}}
{{der-bottom}}
